Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of a Dynamic Age-Dependent PBPK Model for Drug Pharmacokinetics

Participants.evidence: The study setting was virtual, involving 1000 simulated individuals.

Intervention.evidence: Four CYP3A substrates—midazolam, fentanyl, alfentanil, and sufentanil—served as model drugs.

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to develop a dynamic age-dependent physiologically based pharmacokinetic (PBPK) model to predict drug pharmacokinetics across different ages.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the prediction accuracy of plasma concentrations, measured over a simulated timeframe.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation and allocation concealment methods were not applicable.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was not used as this was a simulation study.

Number_Randomised.evidence: The study setting was virtual, involving 1000 simulated individuals.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Observed plasma concentrations mostly fell within the 5th–95th percentile of predicted values in 1000 virtual individuals.
